article.headline: Mississippi 84, La Salle 77
article.story: GUAYNABO, Puerto Rico (AP) -- Eniel Polynice scored 20 points and Chris Warren added 19 to help Mississippi remain undefeated with an 84-77 win over La Salle in the San Juan Shootout on Friday night. Dwayne Curtis and David Huertas added 14 points apiece for the Rebels (10-0), who are off to their best start since 2000-01, when they won their first 11 games. Warren went 4-of-12 from 3-point range to help Mississippi win another close game. Each of the Rebels' last five wins have been by fewer than ten points. Yves Mekongo-Mbala and Rodney Green had 15 points each for La Salle (4-5). It was the first time the Explorers ever played Mississippi, and the first matchup with a Southeast Conference team since La Salle faced Alabama in 1999. Mississippi led 42-29 at the half. The Rebels face No. 15 Clemson on Saturday.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
